Package au.edu.anu.twcore.experiment.runtime.deployment

Class ParallelDeployer

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.cnrs.iees.rvgrid.rendezvous.AbstractGridNode
      • fr.cnrs.iees.rvgrid.statemachine.StateMachineEngine<fr.cnrs.iees.rvgrid.statemachine.StateMachineController>
        • au.edu.anu.twcore.experiment.runtime.Deployable
          • au.edu.anu.twcore.experiment.runtime.deployment.ParallelDeployer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DeployerProcedures, fr.cnrs.iees.rvgrid.observer.Observable<fr.cnrs.iees.rvgrid.statemachine.StateMachineController>, fr.cnrs.iees.rvgrid.observer.Observer, fr.cnrs.iees.rvgrid.rendezvous.GridNode, fr.cnrs.iees.rvgrid.statemachine.StateMachine, fr.ens.biologie.generic.Resettable
    public class ParallelDeployer
extends Deployable
    NB: If / when we figure out how to remove exception suppression, we can just use this deployer. We will want to do that so we can debug cross-factorial experiments. Until then, the SingleDeployer is used if the required number of simulators =1 cf: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2248131/handling-exceptions-from-java-executorservice-tasks

    • Method Detail

      • attachSimulator

        public void attachSimulator​(Simulator sim)
        Add a simulator to the list of currently managed simulators.
        Specified by:
        attachSimulator in class Deployable

      • detachSimulator

        public void detachSimulator​(Simulator sim)
        Remove simulator even if running. This is untested.
        Specified by:
        detachSimulator in class Deployable

      • waitProc

        public void waitProc()
        Call preProcess for all attached simulators then create and submit a thread for each to the pool executor. This method may be called after a paused state. Therefore, any remaining threads must be stopped first so the executor will release them from its queue. Before doing this, the relevant random number generators are reset.

      • ended

        public void ended​(Simulator sim)
        The method is called from the simulator thread after it has reached its stopping condition (if any). Therefore it must be a thread-safe call. The reference to the thread is removed from a thread list. When this list is empty, a finalise event is sent to any listeners.
        Specified by:
        ended in class Deployable

      • runProc

        public void runProc()
        Resumes each simulator thread from a paused state.

      • stepProc

        public void stepProc()
        Resumes and then immediately pauses each simulator thread.

      • pauseProc

        public void pauseProc()
        Pauses each simulator thread from a running state.

      • quitProc

        public void quitProc()
        Shuts down the thread pool executor having first stopping any running simulations. This method is currently only called when running unattended experiments.

      • resetProc

        public void resetProc()
        Calls postProcess for each attached simulator.

      • finishProc

        public void finishProc()
        Currently unused. May be required for experiments required a mix of parallel/sequential simulations.
